gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.util

Class Maths

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.earthquake.nshmp.util.Maths

  • public final class Maths
extends Object
    Miscellaneous math utilities. In some cases, these methods obviate the need for 3rd party imports.
    Author:
    Peter Powers

      • epsilon

        public static double epsilon(double μ,
                             double σ,
                             double x)
        Standardized normal variate ε = (x - μ) / σ.
        Parameters:
        μ - mean
        σ - standard deviation

      • erf

        public static double erf(double x)
        Error function approximation of Abramowitz and Stegun, formula 7.1.26 in the Handbook of Mathematical Functions with Formulas, Graphs, and Mathematical Tables. Although the approximation is only valid for x ≥ 0, because erf(x) is an odd function, erf(x) = −erf(−x) and negative values are supported.

      • hypot

        public static double hypot(double v1,
                           double v2)
        Same as Math.hypot(double, double) without regard to intermediate under/over flow prior to internal call to Math.sqrt(double).
        Parameters:
        v1 - first value
        v2 - second value
        See Also:
        Math.hypot(double, double)

      • hypot

        public static double hypot(double v1,
                           double v2,
                           double v3)
        Three argument form of hypot(double, double). Does not protect against intermediate under/over flow prior to internal call to Math.sqrt(double).
        Parameters:
        v1 - first value
        v2 - second value
        v3 - second value
        See Also:
        hypot(double, double)

      • hypot

        public static double hypot(double... values)
        Variadic form of hypot(double, double). Does not protect against intermediate under/over flow prior to internal call to Math.sqrt(double).
        Parameters:
        values - to process
        See Also:
        hypot(double, double)

      • round

        public static double round(double value,
                           int scale)
        Round a double to a specified number of decimal places according to RoundingMode.HALF_UP. Internally this method uses the scaling and rounding capabilities of BigDecimal. Note that a negative scale will round value to the specified number of places above the decimal.
        Parameters:
        value - to round
        scale - the number of decimal places in the result

      • round

        public static double round(double value,
                           int scale,
                           RoundingMode mode)
        Round a double to a specified number of decimal places according to the supplied RoundingMode. Internally this method uses the scaling and rounding capabilities of BigDecimal. Note that a negative scale will round value to the specified number of places above the decimal.
        Parameters:
        value - to round
        scale - the number of decimal places in the result

      • round

        public static double round(double value,
                           double model)
        Round a double to the nearest specified double. Internally this method uses the scaling and rounding of BigDecimal according to RoundingMode.HALF_UP.
        Parameters:
        value - to round
        model - to round to

      • round

        public static double round(double value,
                           double model,
                           RoundingMode mode)
        Round a double to the nearest specified double. Internally this method uses the scaling and rounding of BigDecimal according to a specified RoundingMode.
        Parameters:
        value - to round
        model - to round to
        mode - to round by

      • decimalToProbabilityConverter

        public static Converter<Double,Double> decimalToProbabilityConverter(int percentScale)
        Return a converter between decimal values and percentages. The forward operation of this converter may be lossy in as much as the supplied decimal value will be rounded to the specified scale after conversion to a percentage. For instance:

        decimalToProbabilityConverter(2).convert(0.23456) = 23.46

        Reverse operations do not affect precision at this time.

        Parameters:
        percentScale - the number of decimal places in percentages output by this converter
